summary: Over 37,000 people were killed in traffic accidents on U.S. highways in 2017. The U.S. Department of Transportation provides about $3 billion a year to states to improve traffic safety. To determine whether the federal money is being spent effectively, states are supposed to set safety targets and report on whether their projects helped achieve them. States did not achieve most of their fatality reduction...
title: Traffic Safety: Improved Reporting Could Clarify States' Achievement of Fatality and Injury Targets
